abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Dead Sea Industrial Exports Project in
            Jordan. The Project's specific objectives of capacity
            expansion using a newly-developed technology, and Technical
            Assistance (TA )for identifying investment options for
            chemicals manufacture, were well conceived and successfully
            achieved. Bank performance has been highly satisfactory
            during all phases of the Project. Borrower performance has
            been highly satisfactory. The key lessons learned were as
            follows: (i) the Bank maintained continuity in task
            management and its relationships with government and Arab
            Potash Company (APC); (ii) Government of Jamaica (GOJ)
            provided guarantees for the establishment of needed
            infrastructure and external financing; and (iii) the huge
            reservoir of brine in the Dead Sea, together with energy
            efficient use of solar ponds provide an opportunity for low
            cost production of potash.
